page.title: 05SHUGBOROUGH MUSEUM
page.content: The building which houses the museum is 200 years old,but the museum was opened 19 years ago. The visitors come from far and wide, but most come from Staffordshire. Approximately 124,000 people come for site visits each year. The museum is open in summer every day except Mondays unless it is a Bank Holiday. The money to run the museum comes from local rates and entrance fees. The museum is trying to depict life in Victorian times. There are 16 different galleries. One is a Victorian schoolroom which local children can visit,dress in period costume and act out the lives of pupils of 100 years ago. The Victorian laundry helps us to picture the busy lives of the laundry maids who once worked at Shugborough Hall.
